title: Pan-Seared Steaks with Brandy–Pink Peppercorn Sauce
ingredients: 2(1-pound) boneless strip or rib-eye steaks, 1 to 1½ inches thick, trimmed and halved crosswise
1tablespoon unsalted butter, plus 3 tablespoons cut into 3 pieces and chilled
directions: 1. Pat steaks dry with paper towels and sprinkle with salt. Heat oil in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat until just smoking. Add steaks and cook, without moving them, until well browned on the first side, about 4 minutes. Flip steaks and continue to cook, without moving, until well browned on the second side and meat registers 120 to 125 degrees (for medium-rare), 3 to 7 minutes. Transfer steaks to a plate, tent with aluminum foil, and let rest while preparing the sauce.

2. Pour off all fat from the skillet, melt 1 tablespoon butter in the now-empty skillet, add shallot, and cook over medium heat until softened, 1 to 2 minutes. Off heat, carefully add brandy, scraping up any browned bits.

3. Stir in broth and peppercorns and return skillet to medium heat. Bring to a simmer and cook until reduced to ⅓ cup, 4 to 6 minutes. Off heat, whisk in remaining 3 tablespoons butter, 1 piece at a time, until melted and sauce is thickened and glossy. Whisk in vinegar and any accumulated steak juices. Season with salt to taste. Serve steaks with sauce.
